definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: Example: A biting, cold wind below in last Sunday, and temperatures dropped sharply in PuYang.
sentences.chinese: 濮陽上週日開始颳起刺骨的寒風，氣溫也急劇下降。

sentences.english: In northern Siberia, bone-chilling winds sweep down from the Pole.
sentences.chinese: 在西伯利亞之北，來自極地的刺骨寒風撲面而吹。

sentences.english: The cold wind pierced him to the bone.
He took a quick look and without another word jumped into the icy water.
sentences.chinese: 他匆忙看了一眼，二話沒說，就跳進冰冷刺骨的水裏。

sentences.english: Outside, a bitter east wind was accompanied by flurries of snow.
sentences.chinese: 外面，刺骨的東風伴着陣陣小雪。

sentences.english: It was so cold that he felt frozen to the marrow .
sentences.chinese: 天氣太冷了，他感到寒冷刺骨。

sentences.english: The order to abandon the ship was given and hundreds of people plunged into the icy water.
sentences.chinese: 棄船的命令發出了，數百人跳進了冰冷刺骨的海水裏。

sentences.english: The bleak winter was over, flowers are in full blossom.
sentences.chinese: 寒風刺骨的冬天已經過去，鮮花正競相開放。

sentences.english: He buttoned his thin coat against the chilling wind.
sentences.chinese: 他扣好單薄的上衣，以便抵擋刺骨的寒風。

sentences.english: The wind was gusting hard and cold.
Even their heavy fur-lined coats could net keep out the piercing cold.
sentences.chinese: 甚至他們的厚毛皮裏大衣也擋不住刺骨的寒冷。

sentences.english: The bitter wind cut through his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 刺骨的冷風吹透了他的夾克衫。

sentences.english: You only have a few hours in those conditions.
sentences.chinese: 在冰冷刺骨的海水中，你只能支撐幾個小時。

sentences.english: The wind really chills me to the bone. / The wind is bone-chilling.

definition: to the bone/to the marrow/fig. to a very large degree
to be extremely cold or painful
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
sound of the wind blowing or rain falling
cold air current/cold ocean current/cold stream
